title: Citibank Philippines Targets Emerging Affluent Segment
summary: Citibank Philippines has announced today that it is setting its sights on the growing emerging affluent segment and introduced its new value proposition focusing on unparalleled access, global banking and personalized services.
tag-1: Citibank Philippines Targets Emerging Affluent Segment
tag-3: Citibank Philippines has announced today that it is setting its sights on the growing emerging affluent segment and introduced its new value proposition focusing on unparalleled access, global banking and personalized services.
tag-4: In a media briefing, Consumer Business Manager for Citibank Philippines Sergio Zanatti said this initiative is part of Citibank's strategy to serve clients as they grow in affluence and their financial requirements evolve through their wealth journey. The emerging affluent is the entry level in a wealth continuum that includes the Citigold brand for the affluent.
tag-5: "We introduced wealth management in the Philippines in the early 1990s, and we have been very successful on this front. In 2010, we outpaced the single-digit industry performance in Asia as we posted a double-digit growth in our customer base. We are tracking that success this year, but recognize that the Citigold market is a finite segment. To continue to grow aggressively, we are looking to the emerging affluent and leveraging on our leadership in wealth management to grow our client portfolio," said Zanatti.
tag-6: As the largest wealth manager in Asia Pacific, Citibank is committed to serve the evolving needs of the rapidly growing market of about 500 million individuals around the region with investible assets from $10,000 to $100,000. It views the emerging affluent segment as a vital part of its wider growth strategy in Asia. The new value proposition underlines the bank's ability to offer leading services to customers at each stage in their lives, and to provide them with the best solutions to grow their wealth. In fact, over 50 percent of Citigold clients in Asia Pacific were originally Citibank clients.
tag-7: The emerging affluent market is seen as one of the fastest growing in the financial services industry in Asia, growing at a rate of 12 to 15 percent year-over-year. Moreover, the revenues from this segment are expected to grow 8-15 percent per year in most countries1.
tag-8: In six Asian countries, Citibank recently conducted an extensive survey of 8,000 emerging affluent individuals, which revealed their profiles, lifestyles and banking preferences.
tag-9: "Our research shows that emerging affluent clients want a bank that values their time, that immediately addresses their needs, and that offers world-class digital banking services. Additionally, these clients are living increasingly global lifestyles and want a bank to support them with their international banking, traveling and investing needs. Our new value proposition seeks to deliver a distinctly higher level of service along all of these dimensions and asks clients to re-think the way they bank and aspire to a higher standard," said Daniel Baranowski, Head of the Emerging Affluent Segment for Citi in Asia Pacific, who flew in to join the media briefing.
tag-10: With operations in more than 100 countries, Citi's global franchise is an increasingly important differentiator as more Asians travel overseas for pleasure, to study and to work, and are thus demanding a truly global banking partner.
tag-11: Retail Banking Director for Citibank Philippines Vipin Agrawal disclosed the features of Citibank's new value proposition, which will set the benchmark for the industry as it raises customer experience to a whole new level:
tag-13: "With our new Call Me Back service, Citibank Philippines will be the first market in Asia to launch this innovative feature, in which we promise our clients that we will call them back anytime, anywhere," said Agrawal.
tag-14: The Citibank emerging affluent value proposition has been launched in Singapore, Hong Kong, China and Taiwan, and it will be launched across Asia over the next 12 months.
tag-15: "We see emerging affluent as a key growth engine for Citibank in the Philippines, and we have a two-pronged channel strategy to address the needs of this market – through a superior digital banking experience and strategic locations of Citibank and Citibank Savings branches nationwide," said Zanatti.
tag-16: Citibank's website for consumer clients was recently refreshed, now featuring an intuitive user interface for easy navigation, simplified menus, as well as advanced features including personal finance tools that give customers flexibility and control over their daily household financial management.
tag-17: Citibank is the leading consumer bank in Asia Pacific with over 31 million retail and card customer accounts and has pioneered the use of internet and mobile banking across Asia. In 2010, Citi's Asia consumer unit was the largest for Citi globally, generating $2.1billion in net income or around 20 percent of Citi's global net income. Citibank is the largest wealth manager in Asia Pacific with over $185 billion assets under management.
tag-18: 1 Credit Suisse Global Wealth Report 2010, McKinsey, Citibank Analysis
tag-19: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
